sen.j: 1丈は約1.67間（＝10/6間）であるため、1方丈は四畳半程度（四畳半の1辺は約1.5間）の広さである。
sen.e: Since 1 jo is about 1.67 ken (=10/6 ken) (ken is a measure of length), 1 hojo is about the size of a four-and-a-half-mat Japanese room (having a side of about 1.5 ken).

sen.e: Since hojo was easily built and easily dismantled, it was favorably used by priests and hermits.

sen.e: The title of the book 'Hojoki' by KAMO no Chomei originates from the fact that he had wrote this book in a hojo hermitage.

sen.e: Also, like seen in an anecdote written in Yuimagyo (Vimalakirti Sutra) that when Monju Bosatsu (Manjusri) and the followers visited a hojo of Yuimakitsu (Vimalakirti) everyone could enter into that small space, in Buddhism, there is a way of thinking that the whole space is inhered in a hojo.
